meanings.definition: Deny the truth of a statement by asserting the opposite.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to contradict her brother's claims.
meanings.sent2: It is not polite to contradict someone during a conversation.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to contradict everything its owner said, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: His actions contradict his words, creating confusion among his friends.
meanings.sent5: The witness's testimony will contradict the suspect's alibi.

meanings.sent1: Her actions seem to contradict her words.
meanings.sent2: The new evidence will contradict the previous findings.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast seems to contradict itself every day.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors of the painting contradict the dark mood of the scene.
meanings.sent5: His calm demeanor contradicts the chaos around him.
